questions: Define angle of incidence and angle of refraction.
answers: Angle of incidence is the angle i made by the incident ray with the normal. Angle of refraction is the angle r made by the refracted ray in the second medium with the normal.

questions: Do, all cartesian sign conventions are applicable in each case of spherical lens as in mirrors ?
answers: Yes, all distances are measured from the optical centre of the lens. Conventionally, the object is placed on the left side of the lens.

questions: Why does light change its path as the medium changes during the transit ?
answers: Speed of light is different in different media. As the medium changes, the light has to choose a path of minimum time. Hence, the direction of the light changes. This phenomenon is know as refraction of light.
